message: I'm also just starting to learn HTML. I found this tutorial to be really helpful: https://www.w3schools.com/html/default.asp
Thanks for the suggestion! I'll check out that tutorial. Do you have any other resources to recommend?
Another good resource is the HTML Handbook on MDN: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Handbook
Thanks for the suggestion! I'll add that to my list of resources. Do you have any other recommendations?
I also recommend checking out the HTML section on Codecademy: https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-html
Thanks for the suggestions! I'll definitely check out all of these resources. Do any of you have any tips for organizing and structuring an HTML document?
I find it helpful to use comments to break up different sections of the HTML document. It makes it easier to navigate and find specific elements.
I also like to use a consistent naming convention for my class and id attributes. It makes it easier to style the elements using CSS.
